Title: toUnixTimestamp
Description: Converts a string, a date or a date with time to the Unix Timestamp in UInt32 representation.
If the function is called with a string, it accepts an optional timezone argument.
Examples: SELECT    '2017-11-05 08:07:47' AS dt_str,    toUnixTimestamp(dt_str) AS from_str,    toUnixTimestamp(dt_str, 'Asia/Tokyo') AS from_str_tokyo,    toUnixTimestamp(toDateTime(dt_str)) AS from_datetime,    toUnixTimestamp(toDateTime64(dt_str, 0)) AS from_datetime64,    toUnixTimestamp(toDate(dt_str)) AS from_date,    toUnixTimestamp(toDate32(dt_str)) AS from_date32FORMAT Vertical;
